page.title: 01Moors SE Of Goathland
page.content: The block is predominantly open rolling hills covered in heather: moorland, and quite high compared to the surrounding countryside. The Eller Back Valley in the N W is farmed and has a few small woods interspersed with grass fields and arable crops. The N Yorkshire Moors Railway runs along this valley. The main A169 also passes through the block. Many peopel stop to enjoy the scenery and to look at the dales early warning station dominating the southern skyline. Walking is also popular on the moors and also around the Goathland area. The moors are used for sheep grazing andf perhaps bee-keeping & grouse shooting. The only residents are the few farmers living near to Gothland.
